text:
Respiratory failure, acute (not ARDS/[**Doctor Last Name 76**])
   Assessment:
   Pt remains on noninvasive CPAP. Lungs with crackles in the bases.
   Action:
   Removed CPAP for PO meds.
   Response:
   Pt quickly became SOB, tachypneic and clammy. Placed back on CPAP.
   Plan:
   Continue CPAP as needed.
   Subdural hemorrhage (SDH)
   Assessment:
   Pt is alert and orientated x 3. Occassionally disorientated. MAEs well.
   Action:
   Neuro exam Q4h. Easily reorientated when wakes confused.
   Response:
   Pleasant, calm and cooperative.
   Plan:
   Continue current POC.
   Renal failure, acute (Acute renal failure, ARF)
   Assessment:
   Low UO. Amber, clear.
   Action:
   No intervention taken.
   Response:
   Labs drawn. Creatinine 1.7.
   Plan:
   Continue POC.
   Pain control (acute pain, chronic pain)
   Assessment:
   Pt c/p oain in back with movement.
   Action:
   Tylenol and ultram given for pain.
   Response:
   Tolerated intermittent back pian well. Comfortable at rest.
   Plan:
   Continue current POC.
